title: Textile, "Horsehair", 2006
medium:
Medium: horsehair, viscose
Technique: hand-woven in plain weave
provenance: June Swindell, Salt UK Ltd.; 2007: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of June Swindell, Salt UK Ltd.
description: Black horse hairs used end to end as the weft, with several inches left unwoven at each side. The warp is white viscose used in irregular vertical bands. The horsehair is used more or less densely to create wide horizontal bands alternating between sheer and opaque.
